Can you provide a source for this claim? I’ve read the docs and lots of articles like https://steemit.com/eos/@ajose01/ethereum-addresses-vs-eos-accounts-a-long-ish-explainer … which seem to say balances are assigned to accounts which public keys are then given authority over.

But unlike Bitcoin, Ethereum etc. you can't just spin up a key pair, share your public key with someone and they can send you EOS or other tokens on the network. You need to have someone (ie. an app) register an account against your public key on the blockchain first.

I'm not trying to generate "FUD" or slam on # EOS, I'm legitimately interested in checking out how it works. But I can't for the life of me figure out how to create an account... if you know how, please let me know. Generating keys with Bitcoin or Ethereum sure feels easier.
